definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: A verb must agree with its subject in number and person.
sentences.chinese: 在數和人稱方面動詞必須與其主詞一致。

sentences.english: In his early samples, George drops subjects about 40% of the time.
sentences.chinese: 在早期範例中，喬治漏掉主詞佔40%。

sentences.english: Complete sentences have a subject and a verb.
sentences.chinese: 完整的句子包含有主詞和動詞。

sentences.english: A substance was supposed to be the persistent subject of varying predicates.
sentences.chinese: 實體被人設想爲是變化不同的謂語之永恆不變的主詞。

sentences.english: The verb must agree with the subject in person and number.
sentences.chinese: 在數和人稱方面動詞必須與其主詞一致。

sentences.english: We now go closer into the specialty of subject and predicate.
sentences.chinese: 現進一步討論主詞與謂詞的特性。

sentences.english: In point of thought, the subject is primarily the individual, and the predicate the universal.
sentences.chinese: 按照它的思想來說，主詞是個體，謂詞是共體。

sentences.english: A sentence usually contains a subject and a verb.
sentences.chinese: 句子通常包括主詞和動詞。

definition: lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
to have no sense of shame/brazen
lit. to share the same bed with different dreams (idiom); ostensible partners with different agendas/strange bedfellows/marital dissension
